title: Understand the Power of a Product Rule
text: When you have an expression in the form $${ab}^n$$, the power of a product rule states that you distribute the exponent $$n$$ to both a and $$b$$.

title: Apply the Power to Each Factor
text: Break the expression $${\left(-2w^3\right)}^3$$ into two distinct parts: $${\left(-2\right)}^3$$ and $${\left(w^3\right)}^3$$. Calculate each one separately.

title: Calculate $$(-2)$$ to the Power of $$3$$
text: Compute $${\left(-2\right)}^3$$, remembering that raising a negative number to an odd power gives a negative result.

title: Apply the Power of a Power Rule
text: For $${\left(w^3\right)}^3$$, apply the power of a power rule, which is $$a^{m n}$$ equals $$a^m$$ times $$n$$.

title: Combine the Results
text: Now, combine the results from $${\left(-2\right)}^3$$ and $${\left(w^3\right)}^3$$ to simplify the expression fully.

title: Final Simplification
text: Combine the results of $$-8$$ and $$w^9$$ to write down the simplified expression.
